inference:
Since $P$ lies on line $BE,$
\[\overrightarrow{P} = (1 - t) \overrightarrow{B} + t \overrightarrow{E}.\]Since $P$ lies on line $CF,$
\[\overrightarrow{P} = (1 - s) \overrightarrow{C} + s \overrightarrow{F}.\]Then
\[(1 - t) \overrightarrow{B} + t \overrightarrow{E} = (1 - s) \overrightarrow{C} + s \overrightarrow{F}.\]We can write $\overrightarrow{E}$ and $\overrightarrow{F}$ in terms of $\overrightarrow{A},$ $\overrightarrow{B},$ and $\overrightarrow{C}$:
\begin{align*}
\overrightarrow{E} &= \frac{1}{3} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{2}{3} \overrightarrow{C}, \\
\overrightarrow{F} &= \frac{4}{5} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{1}{5} \overrightarrow{B}.
\end{align*}Then
\[(1 - t) \overrightarrow{B} + t \left( \frac{1}{3} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{2}{3} \overrightarrow{C} \right) = (1 - s) \overrightarrow{C} + s \left( \frac{4}{5} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{1}{5} \overrightarrow{B} \right).\]Matching coefficients, we get
\begin{align*}
\frac{t}{3} &= \frac{4s}{5}, \\
1 - t &= \frac{s}{5}, \\
\frac{2t}{3} &= 1 - s.
\end{align*}Solving, we find $t = \frac{12}{17}$ and $s = \frac{5}{17}.$  Hence,
\begin{align*}
\overrightarrow{P} &= (1 - t) \overrightarrow{B} + t \overrightarrow{E} \\
&= \frac{5}{17} \overrightarrow{B} + \frac{12}{17} \left( \frac{1}{3} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{2}{3} \overrightarrow{C} \right) \\
&= \boxed{\left( \frac{4}{17}, \frac{5}{17}, \frac{8}{17} \right)}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{\left( \frac{4}{17}, \frac{5}{17}, \frac{8}{17} \right)}.$ I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
From the given information,
\[\overrightarrow{E} = \frac{1}{3} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{2}{3} \overrightarrow{C}\]and
\[\overrightarrow{F} = \frac{4}{5} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{1}{5} \overrightarrow{B}.\]Isolating $\overrightarrow{A}$ in each equation, we obtain
\[\overrightarrow{A} = 3 \overrightarrow{E} - 2 \overrightarrow{C} = \frac{5 \overrightarrow{F} - \overrightarrow{B}}{4}.\]Then $12 \overrightarrow{E} - 8 \overrightarrow{C} = 5 \overrightarrow{F} - \overrightarrow{B},$ so $12 \overrightarrow{E} + \overrightarrow{B} = 5 \overrightarrow{F} + 8 \overrightarrow{C},$ or
\[\frac{12}{13} \overrightarrow{E} + \frac{1}{13} \overrightarrow{B} = \frac{5}{13} \overrightarrow{F} + \frac{8}{13} \overrightarrow{C}.\]Since the coefficients on both sides of the equation add up to 1, the vector on the left side lies on line $BE,$ and the vector on the right side lies on line $CF.$  Therefore, this common vector is $\overrightarrow{P}.$  Then
\begin{align*}
\overrightarrow{P} &= \frac{12}{13} \overrightarrow{E} + \frac{1}{13} \overrightarrow{B} \\
&= \frac{12}{13} \left( \frac{1}{3} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{2}{3} \overrightarrow{C} \right) + \frac{1}{13} \overrightarrow{B} \\
&= \frac{4}{13} \overrightarrow{A} + \frac{1}{13} \overrightarrow{B} + \frac{8}{13} \overrightarrow{C}.
\end{align*}Thus, $(x,y,z) = \boxed{\left( \frac{4}{13}, \frac{1}{13}, \frac{8}{13} \right)}.$
